lessonTitle: Ergative Case Marking in Past Transitive Verbs

exercises.title: Ergative Case Formation
exercises.instructions: Convert each noun or pronoun to Ergative case. Use -მა suffix for nouns, appropriate forms for pronouns.

questions.question: ბავშვი [bavshvi] 'child' → Ergative: _____
questions.explanation: Most nouns ending in -ი drop it and add -მა for Ergative: ბავშვი → ბავშვმა.

questions.question: ის [is] 'he/she' → Ergative: _____
questions.explanation: Third person singular pronoun changes form in Ergative: ის → მან.

questions.question: მასწავლებელი [masts'avlebeli] 'teacher' → Ergative: _____
questions.explanation: Nouns ending in -ი drop it and add -მა: მასწავლებელი → მასწავლებელმა.

questions.question: ისინი [isini] 'they' → Ergative: _____
questions.explanation: Third person plural pronoun changes form in Ergative: ისინი → მათ.

exercises.title: Identifying Correct Case Marking
exercises.instructions: Choose the sentence with correct Ergative case marking.

questions.question: Which sentence has correct Ergative marking?
questions.explanation: Option (b) is correct. In Aorist (Series II) with a transitive verb, the subject must be Ergative: ბავშვმა.

questions.question: Which sentence correctly uses Ergative case?

options.text: მან წაიკითხა წიგნი [man ts'aikit'kha ts'igni] - 'He read the book'

questions.explanation: Option (b) uses Ergative correctly (მან) for a transitive verb in Aorist. Option (a) correctly uses Nominative (ის) for an intransitive verb.

exercises.title: Transitive vs Intransitive
exercises.instructions: Identify whether each sentence has a transitive or intransitive verb, and whether Ergative marking is needed.

questions.question: In 'მე ვირბინე' [me virbine] - 'I ran', should the subject be Ergative?
questions.explanation: No. 'To run' is intransitive (no object), so the subject stays in Nominative case even in past tense. Only transitive verbs use Ergative in Series II/III.
